Author: tigerchik
Text: get the book Brain Over Binge. helped me SO much.  yes, recovery is as hard if not harder, and as miserable or more miserable, than the ED. At first. But it gets better.

Author: cinnamonbicycle
Text: Shit man, I feel this so hard.  I've struggled with anorexia since I was 15. Around August of this year, I decided I truly wanted to recover. And I did. I worked so hard, I challenged myself beyond what I treatment team expected, I gained the weight, I embraced to process. I did so fucking well.  And then it just... died. Something in me just couldn't do it anymore. I always relapse, every time, without fail. This has happened before, this cycle of dedicated recovery, and it always ends the same way. I've come to believe that I simply can't exist without anorexia anymore. It's a part of me. I can't get rid of it.  It hurts that it was all for nothing. I really did try. I did so much hard work to get better. I thought this was it, that I was going to really Recover this time and never go back. And yet, here I am.
